Articles.Content:
That looks incredibly similar to my p-51d, coincidence?

Heh, no coincidence. It was through studying pics of your mods that gave me the idea of making whole fuselage sections with P-Wings. The surprising part is how stable they work in flight.

Heh, no coincidence. It was through studying pics of your mods that gave me the idea of making whole fuselage sections with P-Wings. The surprising part is how stable they work in flight.

indeed, i thought my creations would tear apart and blow up, but with a few struts placed in strategic places (and sometimes no struts at all, p-wings really are sturdy) you get a really great looking design that flies beautifully.

indeed, i thought my creations would tear apart and blow up, but with a few struts placed in strategic places (and sometimes no struts at all, p-wings really are sturdy) you get a really great looking design that flies beautifully.

I don't want to ruin everything or something, but isn't this thread made to share your crafts? Not to discuss how stable wings are... Although, what mods are you guys using? The planes you create are indeed awesome!

Updated British boys:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Please post some more crafts here! I don't want this thread to die, 'cause it is indeed awesome! Thanks for making it, Mr. Pseudonym, and also thanks to andrew123 for redirecting my thread to this, letting me know about this thread, to check out many others replicas!

here are mine

http://imgur.com/a/PDsvK#RPWh5Im

the f-35, the B-2, and the f-14

Edited March 7, 2014 by shadowsutekh
Whoa, that is one sick looking B-2! I haven't seen many people doing the bombers much, though. Nice to see one, y'know?

I just made my first super ssto with both vtol capability and extremely good handling in the lower atmosphere. The updated unsc sabre.

Download file: https://www.dropbox.com/s/lyh7fwc644ah1c8/YSS-2600.craft

1. vtol toggle

2. turbine toggle

3. rapier toggle

4. sensor toggle

See you posted your B-2 on the post I told you on SpacePort! It looks really good, dude!

Edited March 12, 2014 by Bloodbunny

Sick crafts, dudez! That SR-71 is really cool, and your B-2 Spirit is just sick! I'm gonna try to do something similar, uploading it here soon just stay updated and make sure to check them out next time you're turning your computer on! Also subscribe to the thread to get notified about posts, Mr. Pseudonym deserves that for making such an awesome thread!

Sick crafts, dudez! That SR-71 is really cool, and your B-2 Spirit is just sick! I'm gonna try to do something similar, uploading it here soon just stay updated and make sure to check them out next time you're turning your computer on! Also subscribe to the thread to get notified about posts, Mr. Pseudonym deserves that for making such an awesome thread!

You're too kind! Honestly, if I didn't make it, there were several others whose threads got integrated into this one. One of those would've come along.

A slightly overweight V-22 Osprey. Oh and jets. Because rotors? Pleaaaseee.

http://imgur.com/a/Lq0wp

That V-22. The only reason I hate the V-22 is because it replaced the CH-46.

But, I do apreciate the work behind such a peice of art. Though, did you know that the POTUS is not allowed to fly in the Osprey? Too dangerous. Love it.

It is fat though. Wish my computer could run KSP with B9. So sad.
This is my recently made Soyuz:

Mig-17s in formation... prepping for intercept.

http://i.imgur.com/q2mQazU.png

Sending f-14 tomcats for escort on cargo.

So, where's the command module?

Edited March 13, 2014 by Specialist290

So here's a craft I whipped up, out of love for the Oshkosh HEMTT.

Top speed about 21 m/s, but it loves to tip over at that speed, so I wouldn't reccomend it.

If you don't know what the HEMTT is, here's what I based it on:

And here's a link to the Wikipedia page for the HEMTT

And, just for stupidity's sake, I added a feature Jeb would be proud of:

ATTACK!

Successful hit! Range on those missiles is about 3.2km. Spread over about 100 meters when hitting the ground.

Gotta love big millitary trucks

Edited March 16, 2014 by Mr. Pseudonym

Here`s the latest version of my Apollo replica, neither under or over powered. Centre engine cutout on stage 1 and 2, ullage, retro, interstage, 5 ALSEP, 2 kerbal rover (that`s as much fun to drive as the real one). Launcher and CM needs stretchy tanks and the CM needs stupid_chris`s Realchutes. Lander, rover etc is stock.

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Edited March 21, 2014 by John FX

Here`s the latest version of my Apollo replica, neither under or over powered. Centre engine cutout on stage 1 and 2, ullage, retro, interstage, 5 ALSEP, 2 kerbal rover (that`s as much fun to drive as the real one). Launcher and CM needs stretchy tanks and the CM needs stupid_chris`s Realchutes. Lander, rover etc is stock.

http://imgur.com/a/hOo7J

Not bad! I also like how you created almost the EXACT rocket they used in the original Moon landings!

For you WW2 Fanboys/Girls, i made a couple of stock warbirds, am working on more but for now here they are, hope you like them!

All of these planes fly, and fly well, i took inspiration from mareczex333's work and techniques.

- F4U - "Corsair"

- P-38 - "Lightning"

- P-51 - "Mustang"

slitex, try putting the Hv2Xp part of your imgur album and putting it in [imgur] tags like [imgur]Hv2Xp[*imgur] except the last tag has to have a / replacing the * before the imgur (can`t put it there or it won`t show)

Also, for your mediafire link try typing something liek "warbird craft files" then clicking on the link button (world with a thing in front of it to the left of the envelope) then paste your link into the requester box.

Then you should get this
